channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Killamarsh deaths: Man charged with murders of three children and woman
item.description: Damien Bendall is accused of killing Terri Harris and three children at a house in Derbyshire.

item.title: Pen Farthing: Charity Commission scrutinises Afghan animal rescue
item.description: Around 150 animals were evacuated to the UK, along with Paul "Pen" Farthing and animal shelter staff.

item.title: SSD Concerts: Questions over This Is Tomorrow festival work
item.description: Bands severed ties with SSD Concerts amid sexual harassment allegations against the firm's founder.

item.title: '#MeToo gave me confidence to report my sexual abuse'
item.description: Lucy Churchill says the movement led her to report sexual abuse committed against her 25 years ago.

item.title: Sabina Nessa: Murdered teacher's body found hours after attack
item.description: Sabina Nessa's body was discovered in a walkway just off a park in south-east London.

item.title: Manchester flooding: Main roads closed after serious water leak
item.description: Two busy routes in Manchester city centre - Oxford Road and Lloyd Street North - are closed.

item.title: Tyneside foodbank's concerns over Universal Credit cut
item.description: Hebburn Helps fears there will be a rise in foodbank users as the Â£20 Universal Credit uplift goes.

item.title: Man stabbed to death in street fight
item.description: Police find the victim, believed to be in his 30s, with multiple stab injuries on East Ferry Road.

item.title: Almost 2,000 swimming pools could be lost by 2030, says Swim England report
item.description: Almost 2,000 swimming pools in England could be closed by 2030 without urgent government action, a Swim England report suggests.

item.title: People smuggling case: Six charged with bringing Iraqi-Kurds into UK
item.description: The men, from the North East and London, were arrested in a series of raids in February 2018.

item.title: Surrogacy on the rise in England and Wales
item.description: The number of parents having a baby this way has nearly quadrupled in the last decade, figures show.

item.title: Northampton firm which supplied a robe to Prince George reopens after fire
item.description: A gift firm relocates its 120-strong workforce to a new site after its headquarters burned down.

item.title: Drink driver's erratic journey captured on his own dashcam
item.description: Footage shows David Leahy knocking down a street sign, mounting kerbs and hitting a parked car.

item.title: Lillie's virtual Ben Nevis fundraising challenge
item.description: The 10-year-old with cerebral palsy is covering the length of a mountain trail at home.

item.title: Ipswich runner Millie King: 'You've got to be the best you can be'
item.description: The 16-year-old sprinter gets two England call-ups after focusing on training during the pandemic.

item.title: Baby squirrel abandoned on Cambridge patio bonds with carer
item.description: The squirrel, named Paquito, formed an unexpected friendship with his temporary carer.

item.title: Salford woman shares photographs of eczema flare-ups
item.description: Kymmene Dawson shares photographs of stages of eczema flare-ups to raise awareness of the condition.

item.title: Luxembourg 0-10 England: White, Greenwood and Bright each score twice in Women's World Cup qualifier
item.description: Ellen White, Alex Greenwood and Millie Bright each score twice as England thump Luxembourg in their one-sided Women's World Cup qualifier.

item.title: Hungary to play matches behind closed doors after racist behaviour of fans at England game
item.description: Hungary are ordered to play two matches behind closed doors by Fifa following the racism English players experienced at the World Cup qualifier in Budapest on 2 September.

item.title: England v New Zealand: Lea Tahuhu inspires tourists to Leicester victory
item.description: Lea Tahuhu stars with the ball for New Zealand as England slip to a three-wicket defeat in the third game of the five-match one-day international series.

item.title: County Championship: Hampshire hit back against Lancashire on day for bowlers
item.description: County Championship leaders Hampshire are bowled out for 143 but fight back with the ball against title rivals Lancashire.

item.title: QPR 2-2 Everton (8-7 pens): Rafael Benitez's side knocked out by Championship QPR on penalties
item.description: Championship side QPR upset Everton on penalties, after 2-2 draw, to reach the last 16 of the Carabao Cup.
